content.description: The Hospital, Phoebe is arriving with Ross, Joey, and Rachel in tow.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi, yeah, hi! I’m umm, Phoebe Buffay, and I have babies coming out of me.

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Okay. Have you started having contractions?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Not yet. Umm, I heard they really hurt, do they hurt?

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Well…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s all right.

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Now, which of you is the father? (Points to Joey and Ross)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, none of them are the father. The father is my brother.

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Okay…
content.parenthetical: not sure what to do with that

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I am so gonna miss watching you freak people out like that!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, uh Pheebs, quick. Look! This (His video camera) is for the babies to look at someday, so is-is there anything you want to say? Y’know before it all starts?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay, umm, hi kids! Um, it’s me, Aunt Phoebe. I can’t wait to see you. Please don’t hurt me!
(Monica and Chandler come running in.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, what took you guys so long? Your cab left when ours did!
(There’s a pause as they figure out what to say.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, we-we had to go back because I forget my jacket.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s right.
(Both Rachel and Ross stare at her for a moment.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You-you’re not wearing a jacket.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh man! I did it again!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, so umm, somebody has to call Frank and Alice. (As she is talking Joey is sticking the camera under her skirt.) And then my mom wants to know-(notices Joey)-Joey, what are you doing?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I gotta get the before shot!
(She shakes her head no.)

content.description: The delivery room, Rachel and Ross are entering.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, Pheebs? Okay, so just spoke to the nurse and the reason that your doctor is late is because uh, she’s not coming.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Apparently she fell in the shower and hit her head.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, she’s so stupid!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, Pheebs-Pheebs, it’s gonna be okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s easy for you to say, I don’t see three kids coming out your vagina!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, listen, y’know what? The nurse said the doctor is wonderful.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, he’s head of the department.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right—Ooh! Oh dead God, save me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m having my first contraction!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, it’s not bad.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh! (In an announcer type voice) And so the miracle of life begins, and aaiiyyyeeee! (He grabs his side and doubles over in pain.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! You okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, something hurts!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, it’s sympathy pains. Ohh, that’s so sweet!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are they? I didn’t know I cared that much.
(The doctor, Dr. Harad, enters.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: Hi! Phoebe, I’m Dr. Harad, I’m going to be delivering your babies. I want you to know, you’re gonna be in good hands. I’ve been doing this for a long time. I’ll be back in a minute to do your internal, in the meantime, just relax because everything here looks great. And also, I love Fonzie. (Exits)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Did he just say, he loves Fonzie?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s what it sounded like.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right…

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Hey! Am I late? Am I late? Nobody came out yet, right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no-no! We haven’t started yet. Where’s Alice?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Uh, Delaware. She’s on her way though, so until she gets here, I’m gonna be your coach. But don’t worry, she told me all about the la-Mazada stuff.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, that’s when if you get the babies out by the end of the month, they give you 2% financing.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah.

content.description: The waiting room, Monica and Joey are sitting there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica? You gonna be very proud of me. I just got us dates with two unbelievably cute nurses.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: They’re male nurses.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not in my head.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Anyway, they want to take us out Saturday night! What do you say?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm. (Looks at Chandler who is using the phone.) Umm. Umm. I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? What are you talking about?! You-you’re the one who’s been telling me to get over Ross and move on. I’m moving on, and you’re moving on with me. Come on, give me one good reason why you don’t wanna go.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, why don’t you give me something that would be a good reason and-and then I’ll tell you if it’s true.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Harder than it sounds. Isn’t it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, you’re coming with me, and I also told them that if we’re still here when they get off that we’ll go down to the cafeteria and have some Jell-O with them.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yep! There’s always room for Jell-O …

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, how do you make that dirty?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, it’s easy. Yeah, I-I can do it with anything. Watch uh, (snaps his fingers and in a sexy voice) Grandma’s chicken salad…

content.description: The delivery room, Chandler, Frank, and Ross are with Phoebe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross! Get a shot of this. (He’s carrying an issue of the USA Today and hands Ross the camera.) Hey babies! These are the headlines on the day you were born! Okay, now girl baby turn away and boy babies… (Throws the paper away to reveal a copy of Playpen, which is the TV version of Playboy Magazine .) Check it out, huh?! This is what naked women looked like the month you were born. All right, now let’s dive right into the good stuff. (Joey opens the magazine and Ross sticks the camera in it.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay, I’m having another one! This one doesn’t hurt either—Ooh, yes it does! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ooh! (Checks under the blanket.) Oh, I was kinda hoping that was it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, where are Monica and Rachel anyway?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, a couple of nurses asked them out. Maybe they’re with them.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really? Male nurses?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I was bummed too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So they’re going on dates? When?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I think Saturday—(groans in pain again).

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: What’s with him?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, sympathy pains. I thought it was really sweet at first, but now I think he’s just trying to steal my thunder.

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: Let’s see what we got here. Ohh, y’know, Fonzie dated triplets.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This-this Fonzie person you keep referring too, is that uh, is that another doctor?

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: Oh no-no-no. Fonzie is the nickname of Arthur Fonzerelli. The Fonz.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right.
(Dr. Harad exits.)

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: It’s not that weird, is it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s very weird! I don’t want some guy down there telling me, I’m y’know, dilatedamundo!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: To be fair, he doesn’t seem to be impersonating Fonzie…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What are you doing?!! Why are you defending him?! Just get me another doctor! One who is not crazy and who is not Fonzie!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Again, it’s not that he…
(Phoebe fakes pain to get Ross looking for another doctor.)

content.description: The waiting room, Chandler is looking for Monica.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-hey-hey-hey! There you are!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, listen there’s something I think you should know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, is this about you-you dating the nurse? Yeah, Joey already told me, and I am so-so fine. I mean, you and I we’re just, y’know, we’re nothing, we’re goofin’ around.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm, actually I was about to tell you that I was, I was going to get out of it, but hey, if we’re just goofing around then uh, maybe I will go out with him.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fine! Maybe I will too!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, you guys! Look what I found in the giiiiiiift shop. (He doubles over in pain in front an old man in a wheel chair.) Get up! Get up! Get up! (The old man waves him away.)
content.parenthetical: entering from the elevator caring gifts for the kids

content.description: The delivery room, Ross has returned with another doctor. This one, is well, younger.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, Phoebe, this Dr. Oberman. He has no strong feelings about Fonzie or any of the Happy Days gang.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi! And you’re going into what grade?

content.speaker: Dr. Oberman
content.text: Umm, I’m actually a first year resident, but I get that a lot, you see, I-I graduated early…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh, me too. Ross, maybe I should’ve specified that I’d be needing a grown up doctor.

content.speaker: Dr. Oberman
content.text: Oh no, I’m fully qualified to…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Shh! Doogie, shh! Doesn’t anybody understand that I’m gonna be having babies soon? Huh? Go! Go little boy, go!
(He runs out and Frank watches him go.)

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Oh cool! You made him cry!

content.description: Another hospital room, Joey has now been admitted and his doctor is about to break the bad news to him, Monica, and Chandler.

content.speaker: Joey’s Doctor
content.text: Mr. Tribbiani, I’m afraid you’ve got kidney stones.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Umm, well, what else could it be?

content.speaker: Joey’s Doctor
content.text: It’s kidney stones.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Or?

content.speaker: Joey’s Doctor
content.text: Kidney stones!

content.description: The delivery room, Dr. Harad is back and checking on Phoebe.

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: All right, you’re getting there. Oh, and y’know, these babies are very, very lucky.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: They are. Why?

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: They have the honor of being born on The Fonz’s half-birthday.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Happy birthday!

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: Just-just to clarify, I’m not Fonzie. (Phoebe nods in agreement as he leaves.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, y’know I just gotta tell you, I think this is such a terrific thing you’re having these babies for Frank and Alice.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know, it is.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Can I tell you a little secret?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I want to keep one. (Giggles in excitement.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, I’m gonna be on the news!

content.description: The delivery room, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, Phoebe, honey, you gotta be kidding. I mean, you know you cannot keep one of these babies!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why not?! Maybe I can, you don’t know!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! Yes! Yes, I do! I do know! Frank and Alice are gonna want to keep all of their children!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe not! Y’know? Seriously, three babies are a handful maybe they’re y’know, looking for a chance to unload one of them. Listen, I-I hate to miss an opportunity just because I didn’t ask ! Y’know?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, no! This is, this is insane.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, just ask him!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Me?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t ask him! Do you have any idea how inappropriate that would be?! All I’m saying is just talk to Frank. Okay? Just, y’know, feel him out!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Forget it! I am not gonna ask Frank to give you one of his kids!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re right.
(There’s an awkward silence then suddenly Phoebe gets an idea.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Tell him it’s for you.

content.description: Joey’s room, his doctor, Chandler, and Monica are there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Feeling a little better sweetie?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, maybe a little. I wish you hadn’t seen me throw up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Me too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! I just heard. What’s up?

content.speaker: Joey’s Doctor
content.text: Kidney stones! Now, ordinarily Mr. Tribbiani, we try to break up the stones up with shock waves, but they’re to close to the bladder now. Which means we can either wait for you to pass them or else go up the urethra…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa-whoa! No-no-no-no-no, nothing is going up! Okay? Up, up is not an option—what’s a urethra? (Monica whispers what it is in his ear.) Are you crazy?!

content.description: The delivery room, Rachel and Frank are there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So did you ask him?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I haven’t had a chance to be alone with him yet.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I’m kinda on a clock here.

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: Oh Fonzie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know who I always liked? Mork.
(Dr. Harad drops what he’s doing and stares at her.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Undo it. Undo it. Undo it.

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: Fonzie met Mork. Mork froze Fonzie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, but umm… Yes, but, Fonzie was already cool, so he wasn’t hurt, right?

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: Yeah, that’s right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How are you doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, doctor says any minute now.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Hey, y’know, Alice is gonna be here so soon, you couldn’t just like do me a favor and like, like hold them in?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sorry Frank, I’m kinda in the middle of the last favor you asked me to do.
(A male nurse enters.)

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, this is Dan (points to him), one of the guys that we’re gonna be going out with on Saturday. (Mouths “He’s yours.” to her.) Uh Dan, Monica.

content.speaker: Dan
content.text: Nice to meet you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello Dan! I’m really looking forward to Saturday night! Really, really!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So Dan, nurse not a doctor huh? Kinda girlie isn’t it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler!

content.speaker: Dan
content.text: Nah that’s okay. I’m just doing this to put myself through medical school.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Dan
content.text: And it didn’t feel so girlie during the Gulf War.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sure. (Pause) And listen, thanks for doing that for us, by the way. (Retreats in defeat.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, why wait ’til Saturday, are you free tomorrow?

content.speaker: Dan
content.text: Sure! I’ll get somebody to cover my shift.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, great!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, how ‘bout it? You, me, Saturday night?

content.speaker: Delivery Room Nurse
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right. Very good.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oo, this is a big one. Eww! Arghhhh!!
[Cut to Joey’s room, who’s going throw his own contractions. Plus, he has Ross in a headlock.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh, get these things out of me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Breathe! Breathe! Breathe throw the pain.
(Joey starts breathing hard)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I want the drugs Ross, I want the drugs! (He starts rocking back and forth, taking Ross with him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I do too! I do too!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Argh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Argh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Argh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Argh!

content.description: The waiting room, Frank is on the phone as Rachel approaches.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah, I love you. Okay, bye! (To Rachel) Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: That was Alice’s mom, she said she left five hours ago. She should be here by now!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, honey, don’t worry. She’s gonna make it on time.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. So Frank, three babies. Whew, that just seems like a lot, huh?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Not to me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, fair enough.

content.description: The delivery room, later on, Rachel, Chandler, Monica, and Frank are there as Dr. Harad is checking out Phoebe.

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: Okay, you’re at ten centimeters. Time to start having some babies. All right, I want only the father in here please.
(They all kiss her and wish her luck.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bye Dan!

content.speaker: Dan
content.text: Uh, bye Monica.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bye, momi-moo.
(Everyone except Frank leaves.)

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: All right, I need a clamp, sterile towel, and channel 31.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What is that?
(Dan turns on the TV and the Happy Days theme song comes on.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: Oh, no-no-no, it’s a good one! Fonzie plays the bongos. All right, are you ready? It’s time to start pushing.
[Cut to Joey’s room, his doctor and Ross are there.]

content.speaker: Joey’s Doctor
content.text: Are you ready? It’s time to try peeing. (Joey makes a face like he is trying to pee.) Wait-wait-wait-wait-wait! It’s almost time to try peeing. (Points at the bottle Joey is to pee into.)
[Cut to the delivery room.]

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: Okay, now push! That’s it push! Just concentrate on pushing! Yeah, here we go!

content.speaker: Dan
content.text: I see the head.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yes, it has a head!

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: All right. Keep pushing! Come on!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: I can’t believe there’s somebody coming out of you right now. There’s somebody coming out of you! Is it? Is it? It’s my son.

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: All right. Here’s your first baby.
[Cut to the waiting room, a triumphant Frank rushes in.]

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: YESSSSS!!!!! We got a baby boy!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Frank Jr. Jr.!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, how does he look? How does he look?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: So gross! (He runs back to the delivery room.)
[Cut to the delivery room, Phoebe is about to give birth to the middle kid.]

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: Okay. You ready to push again?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I already had a baby. Leave me alone.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Okay, okay, come on, you can do it. You can do it!
(Phoebe screams in pain, and Frank screams with her.)
[Cut to the waiting room, a twice triumphant Frank returns.]

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah!! Little Leslie is here! We got another one! Oh my God, I can’t believe I have two-two children. How scary is that? (He returns to the delivery room.)
[Cut to the delivery room, Phoebe is at it for the last time.]

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Come on little Chandler, it’s time to be born. Come on little Chandler! Come on!

content.speaker: Dr. Harad
content.text: All right, he’s coming. He’s coming!
(They both stare at the newborn.)

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Hey, where’s his thing?
[Cut to the waiting room, a thrice triumphant Frank returns again.]

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Chandler’s a girl!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh God, kindergarten flashback.

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: They musta read the sonogram wrong. ’Cause they, ’cause they thought it was a boy, but Chandler’s a girl! Chandler’s a girl!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, keep saying it!

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Am I too late?!

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: No-no ah, everything’s okay. Everybody’s healthy there’s 30 fingers and 30 toes.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: We have our babies?

content.speaker: Frank
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Oh, we have our babies.
(They hug. And quickly that hug turns into a heated make out session, right there on the waiting room couch. Chandler, Rachel, and Monica quickly make their exits.)

content.description: Joey’s room, he is recovering from his birth.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You did it, man.

content.speaker: Joey’s Doctor
content.text: Would you like to see them? (He hands Joey a little jar.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They’re so small! (Both he and Ross look at them with satisfied looks on their faces.)

content.description: A hallway, Monica and Dan are talking.

content.speaker: Dan
content.text: So, I’ll call you tomorrow.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Great!
(Dan leaves as Chandler enters.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, are you really gonna go out with that nurse man?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well uh, you and I are just goofing around, I thought, why not goof around with him.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I don’t know if you’ve ever looked up the term goofing around in the dictionary… Well, I have, and the technical definition is, two friends who care a lot about each other and have amazing sex and just wanna spend more time together. But if you have this new fangled dictionary that gets you made at me, then we have to, y’know, get you my original dictionary. I am so bad at this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think you’re better than you think you are.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really? Okay, so…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Know when to stop.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I sensed that I should stop. So we’re okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. All right, I’m gonna go tell Dan that it’s not gonna happen. (They kiss and as she starts to leave, Chandler starts to dance. Without turning around.) Don’t do the dance.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Right!

content.description: The delivery room, everyone except Rachel is there. Phoebe, Monica, and Ross are holding the babies.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think you’re my favorite.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Which one do you have?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t care.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi. (To Phoebe) Hey, hi! So uh, Frank and Alice wanted me to tell you that they’re still outside making phone calls.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But umm, I mean, did you talk to them about, y’know…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, umm, no honey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. It was a long shot. Hey, you guys can I just like have a second alone with the babies.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah, sure yeah. Yeah.
(They hand her the babies and leave them alone.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, here you are. It seems like yesterday I was talking to you in that little petri dish. Everyone said labor was the hardest thing I’d ever have to do, but they were wrong this is. Oh, I had the most fun with you guys! I wish I could take you home and see you everyday. Okay, I’ll settle for being your favorite Aunt. I know Alice’s sister has a pool, but you lived in me. Okay, so we’re cool. Yeah, we’re gonna be great. Little high fives! (Imitates the high fives.) Ahh! Ahh! Ahh! (One of the babies begins to cry.) Well, if you’re gonna cry. (She starts crying.)

content.description: The delivery room, everyone is hanging out with Phoebe. Frank, Alice, and the kids aren’t there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, we are so proud of you! You’re amazing!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So does it really hurt as bad as they say?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. You won’t be able to take it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So uh, now that little Chandler turned out to be a girl, what are they gonna name her?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: They’re gonna call her Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s kind of a masculine name, don’t you think?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Works on you.
